meanings.sent1: The children played in the schmutz-covered yard.
meanings.sent2: She wiped the schmutz off the window to let more light in.
meanings.sent3: The puppy rolled around in the schmutz and got all messy.
meanings.sent4: The old book was covered in schmutz, showing its age.
meanings.sent5: The schmutz on the floor made it slippery and dangerous to walk on.

meanings.sent1: The alley was filled with schmutz and garbage.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't stand the schmutz on his hands after fixing the car.
meanings.sent3: The chef refused to cook in a kitchen full of schmutz.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation was tarnished by the schmutz of gossip.
meanings.sent5: The detective found a clue hidden in the schmutz of the crime scene.

meanings.definition: A small or insignificant amount of dirt or debris
meanings.sent1: There was a bit of schmutz on the edge of the table.
meanings.sent2: She brushed the schmutz off her shoulder without noticing.
meanings.sent3: The car had a speck of schmutz on the windshield.
meanings.sent4: The artist carefully removed the schmutz from the delicate painting.
meanings.sent5: The clean room had a single speck of schmutz that stood out.
